info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 6 at 11:25PM PDT until May 7 at 12:45AM PDT by NWS Las Vegas NV
info.description:
* WHAT...Heavy rainfall earlier this afternoon has resulted in persistent flooding along the Colorado River Valley, particularly in Fort Mohave. Ongoing light rainfall will continue to exacerbate this issue from Searchlight down through Laughlin, Needles, and Lake Havasu City as clean up efforts persist.
* WHERE...Portions of northwest Arizona, including the following county, Mohave, southern California, including the following county, San Bernardino, and southern Nevada, including the following county, Clark.
* WHEN...Until 1245 AM PDT /1245 AM MST/.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1122 PM PDT /1122 PM MST/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lake Havasu City, Bullhead City, Laughlin, Topock, Highway 95 At Mile Marker 29, Katherine Landing, Parker Dam, Needles, Arizona Village, Mohave Valley, Mojave Ranch Estates, Highway 95 And I-40, Mesquite Creek, Big Bend Rec Area, Oatman, Desert Hills, Cal-Nev-Ari, Vidal Junction, Three Dunes Campground and Black Meadow Landing Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
